meta.description: Aspire Lounge at San Diego International Airport (SAN), Terminal 2. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Aspire Lounge

location.terminalDirections: After the security checkpoint for Gates 20-32, head left. This lounge is located before the bridge leading to Gates 33-50.

lounge.description: The Airspace Lounge offers customers hushed separation from the busy airport concourse, an array of unlimited complimentary snacks and beverages, plus a selection of hot entrees from the Airspace Lounge premium menu (at an additional cost). Recharge with an invigorating shower, and enjoy the comfortable seating and expansive airport views.

warning: This lounge may stay open later during periods of heavy delays. Operating hours are subject to change
regulatory: This lounge is accessible to all passengers departing from Terminal 2.

reviews.content: No longer offer a $10 voucher. However, drinks are now complimentary. Food options are still basic, but worth the detour.
It’s a fine lounge. It’s not the Centurion Lounge but you know that walking in. I’ve been here at least 5 times and never been impressed. And it’s always dirty for some reason.
Pretty mediocre lounge. Nothing terrible but definitely inferior to, say, a typical Admirals Club.
I sat at the bar, with 3 other people, for 35 minutes and the bartender never even said hello or I’ll be right with you.  Never got a drink.  Seriously horrible service.
Bar staff was pleasant and kind. Entry staff was nice. Fairly busy on a Thursday evening departure but still ample seating and quick service.
Staff is disinterested. Oddly only JAL passengers can get cup noodles. Bright - Large windows show the tarmac.
Do not come here if hungry or thirsty. The selection is quite light and only slightly better than the general terminal. Very bright and not too quiet.
A very OK lounge. Better than nothing.
Power doesn’t work, Wi-Fi doesn’t work, “free” food and drink non-existent. Disinterested staff. Avoid.
Nice space. Clean.  Decent seating. Better then sitting in the general terminal. Food is OK. Would be nice to have some healthier options like salad.  Free food is cheese, Chex mix, cookies...
For the price, it’s definitely worth it if you’ll be in the airport for a few hours. I just wish there were more couches, or chairs that reclined, so I could stretch out my legs.
$20 for a margarita. And extremely limited options for free food. Their buffalo chicken tastes like leftover tuna.
Nice space to post up before a flight. $10 credit per person which is solid. Breakfast sandwich is not tasty, but good coffee and juice selection. Mid grade lounge worth a visit.
10 dollar credit with your Platinum Card entry per person is nice. Good selection at the bar. Basic selection for grab and go but decent menu available too. Busy but to be expected.
Great staff. Beautiful, clean lounge. Not a lot of snack options but the $10 credit from American Express is great start!
Super friendly staff and a $10 AMEX Platinum credit. Views of the runway and comfy chairs with lots of outlets available.
Friendly staff, some complimentary drinks, $10 credit for AMEX will get you a small snack. Nice view of the tarmac.
Spacious, quiet, comfortable. Great floor to ceiling windows looking out at the tarmac. Lots of outlets. Definitely stop in if you have some time to kill at SAN.
Home Base Airport Lounge. Worthy of a visit while at SAN. Friendly and professional staff, they offer a $10.00 credit on food, and no item is over the credit amount.
There’s nothing fancy about it, but it’s better than nothing! Enter with your Amex if you have it, even if you have Admirals Club or AA status, for the $10 food credit!
I love coming here. Everyone is always friendly. Great place to grab a snack, coffee or chat at the bar.
Comfortable enough, but wouldn’t go out of my way to spend more time here if I could avoid it. It’s nothing special.

Apparently belongs to Japan Airlines. No taking food order from bar seat - go to the cash register and take a number. Filthy fan at the bar with bar tools less than six inches in front of it (see pics).
Really friendly staff and worth a stop for a drink. Snacks are subpar and chicken salad sandwich is okay.
Great staff. Mediocre lounge compared to others. Ok overall.
Extremely busy, no seats, staff stretched to the limits. Bigger lounge is needed.
My flight was cancelled and the next flight delayed. It was incredibly crowded due to the cancellations and the AA reps were very patient and helpful. The food selection isn’t very good, however.
Small lounge. Open space okay for a quick bite to eat and a drink.
Airy lounge, great view of the tarmac. Free food opts are basic (cheese/crackers) but premium food can be ordered off the menu. Helpful staff, worth a detour.
Awesome customer service, friendly staff. Location is a bit hidden, hard to find. Very basic food selection. Just wish they could add some comfortable chairs/couches..
Overall good experience. Not as many amenities as other airport lounges and is only accessible in Terminal 2 which is a real disappointment. Decent food and drink options available.
Kind of a dump. Low quality snacks provided. $10 voucher is not great considering a drink can run $15. Very busy. At this moment 12:30pm there are 11 people in line waiting to order food or beverage.
Why complain about this lounge, Lounge Lizards? New, bright, high ceilings, Tarmac views. $10. Credit with the free AMEX Platinum You can use it on drinks and food. Not Centurion lounge, but nice.
Clean & friendly staff. Great place to get away from Terminal 1 if you have time. Don't even bother with security, head straight here for your $10 card/voucher, order a snack or drink & relax.
The lounge is acceptable and does not give the mentioned 10 complimentary dollars to Sapphire members like LATAM platinum.
I think it's a great lounge. Never really gets full and the staff is professional. Great tarmac views as well.
I'm giving this club 5 stars because I'm thankful it exists. The only other clubs are United and Delta but I usually fly British Airways when I vacation in Paris so this club is a nice place to rest.
Really small lounge. Very noisy. Basically no food. There have one shower. Coffee is OK.  Not a lounge where you want to spend more than 1h.
$5 for a handful of olives. Very little complimentary. Just bad bad bad. I left and went back into the airport.
I was here in the morning from around 8-9am and it was quiet and peaceful.  Nice tarmac views also! Excellent Bloody Mary too!
Small but comfy lounge. Horrid food selection though. Breakfast was basically non-existent.
Very low quality purchase food, water drinks for excessive price, free coffee maker was empty even on a slow day. Just another slap for loyal American EP and Members.
Sparse... Other than getting away from the crowds, not much attractive about this lounge.
A really nice clean spacious lounge but no offer of $10 voucher for food.
Eeh...quaint, really simple. No hot food included with purchase. And airport/airline employees everywhere...what's that about?
The lounge is pretty nice. Limited snack items, however food not bad once you include the Amex Platinum $10 per person credit. I would certainly visit again.
Okay lounge, relatively quiet, limited food options. Clean and bright.
Does triple duty as AA, JAL and independent; nice when quiet, but major JAL departure completely overwhelms staff. $10 credit is nice, but not when there's no servers to spend it with.
No issues with AMEX Platinum. Nice lounge with complimentary drinks and small snack selection. Food to order.
Fairly straightforward lounge. What makes it stand out, though, are the views and the $10 credit they give for food/beverages for AMEX Platinum cardholders. Bright and airy.
Staff is very friendly; I came in with my wife and 4 kids by showing my Amex Platinum card. With Amex Plat they give you $10/person to spend on food & drinks so we rec'd $60. Nice views.
Great size, ladies are friendly bartenders, guy is a bit much to handle. Spacious place with good wifi and plenty of seats. Could use better snacks.
Wonderful light and airy space to relax in preflight with airfield views. Lots of comfy seats or working spaces. A variety of paid for food and drinks plus free coffee / sodas. Wifi only so so.
Direct left after security. A little crowded but still enough space. Basic drinks included, pretty good food options and you can get them to go too.
Lovely check in. Plenty of power outlets. Food selection is limited, but the place is quiet, which is what I'm after, plus decent WiFi.
Like a swanky bar with $10 credit with Amex Platinum so you can get a Johnny Walker Black for $2.16! Not too busy, totally hidden between terminals. Free house bloody Marys at the bar.
Here due to business class ticket on BA. Free quality food and drink. Nice locale, free wifi too. Not much view but so what.
Nice space, you get $10 voucher per person so worth bringing in a guest to get more credit.
I'm not sure why this only gets 2 stars. I am here Monday mornings and the Amex check in is good. Great atmosphere. I've had the breakfast sandwich and the continental. Both were excellent.
Just so so. You can have coffee and fruit there. $10 coupon is good.
Nice view of the runway. Snacks like check mix, cookies and oranges are complimentary. Meals are obtained with $10 voucher given at the entrance. my first experience with vouchers in an Amex lounge.
They've got comfortable seats, complimentary chex mix snacks, fruit, and cookies, as well as a few choices for complimentary soft drinks, wine & beer. Not a bad place to spend a few hours.
Lovely lounge overlooking the runway. Easy to get to, just take a left hook after security and it's on the right. 10$/person credit when checking in with Amex Platinum up to 10 people.
First lounge experience.  Very limited complimentary snacks.  Great espresso from the machine and lovely server/bar tender.  Clean, quiet, ok wifi.
Similar to other lounges but more crowded. $10 credit with plat card is good for some solid food though.
Free entrance and $10 food and beverage voucher with AX Platinum Card. That's enough for a premium drink or pretty decent quality snack. Very open feeling, lots of windows, not very crowded.

Love this lounge. "Paid" food is excellent, lovely service/staff, great views, clean and modern. My only gripe is that the "free" snacks are a bit lacking. Chex mix, oranges, and small muffins is all.
A nice airy space overlooking the tarmac by gate 23. An improvement on the old Club that felt dark and enclosed. Food and drink is the standard, though JAL passengers have additional free selections.
Nice lounge at SAN. Overlooking Gate 23 and 33 in T2. Great bar and beer selection. The breakfast smoothie is Naked Juice smoothies. Not crowded. $10 per person credit with AMEX Plat.
Large modern lounge with great view!  Best beer selection I have seen at a lounge.  Nice little food menu as well.
A little hard to find due to signage but worth it. Have both AMEX and Admirals Club cards, so used AMEX because of the Airspace Lounge $10pp credit. One critique, complimentary snacks are lacking.
Amex Platinum card holders receive a $10 card to spend. That covers one food or beverage. Great view of the runway and Terminal 2.
Decent lounge. Had great service being one of only a handful in the lounge waiting for a red eye. Bartender was bringing me drinks to my seat before I could ask for another!
It's included with Amex Plat so that's a big plus. Average domestic lounge, limited food, but a full bar.
Basic lounge. Nice place for a snack.
Standard domestic lounge once it is finished.

location.terminalDirections: Located just across Airport Terminal Road from Terminal 2. From Terminal 2, follow the signs to the USO center and go over the sky bridge.

otherLounges.name: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club

location.terminalDirections: Mezzanine Level, above Sunset Cove, between Gates 47 and 48.
Mezzanine Level, above Sunset Cove, between Gates 47 and 48.
